Dead Gods

The Dead Gods were the God creators of Marlien, so called by the Charon because they seem to have at one time entered into their Creation, but then destroyed themselves.

History

The dead gods, which may in fact have been one, singular entity, were the primary sculptors of Marlien.

Deeming their view from beyond its walls too imprecise and warped by the actions of lesser atman through internal_mechanisms of their own making, the dead gods entered into it Marlien at the dawn of time with the intent to reform it drastically from within, where they could see more clearly, and act as a guiding hand for all time. Upon entry into their Creation, and first perception of temporal existence, however, the dead gods realised immediately that their own perfectionist nature and competing goals would lead to naught but an eternal cycle of destruction and redesign; this was the true cause of the lack of clarity they perceived from the Great Beyond - not the actions of lesser atman, but of themselves.

Whether an outcome of rational thought, or a product of their dissonance, the gods were then torn apart by their own will, showering all Marlien with vast quantities of undirected will, and yet leaving the world for the most part as they had sculpted it from outside.

In this event the Marlien Girdle was infused with such a quantity of mana that the resident soul stewards together do not wield enough mana to tear it down should they decide that the Creation is too hazardous for resident atman. As a result, they have settled in for the long-haul, carving out their own plane, The Halls of the Charon, and creating a legion of charon mortals to help guard the other trapped atman.

Dissonance

The dissonance of the dead gods are a personification of their incompatible desires which lead to their indefinite pursuit of perfection, and eventual destruction. It is impossible to define whether the dead gods were one atman or many, nor what the impact of their individuals might have been before their destruction, and so only the dissonance are named.

  • Thechtonon, of Knowledge
  • Hlidera, of Beauty
  • Ubrikant, of Dynamism
  • Betrodum, of Predestination
  • Gelfexinerey, of Magiks
  • Sathlid, of Luck
